author: Special Correspondent
text:
The break away group of Telangana Telugu Desam Party legislators has urged Assembly Speaker S. Madhusudana Chary to allow the merger of the group into the ruling TRS with immediate effect.

In a letter submitted to the Speaker, TTDP MLAs, who switched their loyalty to TRS, said a meeting was conducted on the Assembly premises on Thursday to discuss the TDP Legislature Party’s merger with the TRS in the Legislative Assembly. Accordingly, the 10 MLAs who attended the meeting decided to seek the merger of the TDP legislature party into the TRS.

The MLAs — T. Srinivas Yadav, E. Dayakar Rao, G. Sayanna, T. Prakash Goud, T. Krishna Reddy, Manchireddy Kishan Reddy, Madhavaram Krishna Rao, K.P. Vivekananda Goud, S. Rajender Reddy and Challa Dharma Rao — signed the letter addressed to the Speaker. They said the party had the required strength of two-thirds as mandated under Para 4 of the X schedule of the Constitution to seek their merger into the TRS.

The members wanted the Speaker to take a decision in this regard immediately.
title: Telangana TDP MLAs submit petition for merger into TRS
